projectPurpose: To provide a user-friendly graphical interface for performing common WiFi security auditing tasks, specifically deauthentication attacks and password cracking, by acting as a frontend to the aircrack-ng suite.

alternatives.name: Kismet
mainFeatures: Supports multiple wireless protocols (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, etc.)

alternatives.name: Hashcat
mainFeatures: Utilizes CPU, GPU, and other accelerators

marketPositioning: Airgorah is positioned as a user-friendly graphical interface (GUI) wrapper for the widely used command-line aircrack-ng suite. It aims to make common WiFi auditing tasks, such as deauthentication attacks and password cracking, more accessible to users who prefer a visual interface over command-line tools. While leveraging the core functionality of aircrack-ng, its GUI is its primary differentiator compared to the original suite and other command-line focused tools like Kismet, Hashcat, and John the Ripper, which either focus on different aspects of network analysis or are general-purpose crackers. Airgorah specifically targets Linux users requiring a simpler approach to active WiFi security testing.
